intro: Betonica bjelorussica, commonly known as the Belarusian betony, is a flowering plant native to Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly woolly texture. Betonica bjelorussica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
